1lnxe0vA2hf5wZpOUxoaTg.text: We recently came on a Thursday night. We had to wait about 35-40 minutes for a table for 4 which was is expected in this area of town. The food was exceptionally good and a nice change from the pub/touristy food that seems so common in old town. The waiter Michael was outstanding and the rest of the staff was nice too.

fdIIlozsrV21gva3MROSBw.text: Excellent meats and great mash!  Staff was accommodating when we came in with 5 people and they were pretty packed.  We squeezed into a table for 4 and made it work.  We tried 3 different meats and 3 different mashed and enjoyed them all.  I also recommend the smoked sausage skins!

43bbYcQ4mpMvyti_QUbZxQ.text: Great food and great service at this place. Who knew such great things could happen to mashed potatoes!

P07o2i-wX6lcP9ptK9OpeQ.text: Yelp helped me find this delicious restaurant for lunch. The vegetarian portobello option was delicious to the last bit. I usually don't finish a plate but it was hard not to stop. The sticky pudding was perfect!!

REARiMmcREkyUbHa4MIvDA.text: Great place! Try the haggis it is fantastic. Overall a great experience, we will definitely be back.

37h65sj3P2QJQ1gmumQalQ.text: This was our first meal in Edinburgh. The food was amazing!  Louise was our server and she was very friendly and informative. I had the gammon and my husband had the Bonnie Prince Charlie Chicken. It was very well presented and tasted delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom

C4nqLXCw4X19q1uXvZ33XQ.text: Whenever I travel, there's always one or two meals I end up missing when I go home. Makars definitely makes the list for this trip. My travel companion and I were in the mood for good comfort food and this place exceeded our expectations. I had the vegetarian sausage with cheddar and chive mash and it was phenomenal. I couldn't stop saying "wow" after each bite. My sister had the lamb and bacon mash which she also said was delicious (I am a vegetarian so I took her word for it). We saved room for the sticky toffee pudding with butterscotch sauce, which was also delicious. I will be missing this meal when I go home.

Wrky5QhO2xZWfE-ft3kJEA.text: The perfect place for convenient tasty comfort food in a pleasant space with lots of windows. The service was friendly and efficient.

dgT-p2r_yxy_nXO8xMa6kg.text: Really enjoyed the food, the staff were fab. It is amazing to see what they are doing with the humble spud. I had haggis and it was just the right side of spicy. Well done you guys

-fWGuCrd5vit45xdeFaDnw.text: Where do I begin, we really loved this place while we visited Edinburgh Scotland. We ended coming to this place a few times just because the food and beer was great. I had the Haggis with black pudding mash and talk about an experience. I really debated ordering another one just because it was really good and reminded me of something my mom made when I was young. I enjoyed every bite and was willing to order more. My wife ordered the Ox cheeks with black pudding mash and that was very good as well. The next time we ate I of course had the same thing but my wife tried the smoked Gammon with bacon mash and that was really good. I would order that  if we ever go back again. We enjoyed the Belhaven Black beer and that was delicious. The service both times was great. We had three children in our group and they sat us away so we can make us much noise as we need the boys really enjoyed their tomato soup and both cleaned their bowl. Let's not forget their dessert sticky toffee pudding, out of this world good. We love this place and you must try it if your in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Haggis with Black Pudding Mash. Must try Haggis when in Scotland with a nice Belhaven black beer

m9l91rBYmgfvCE4k1K9mYA.text: Excellent food with local craft beers and cider. We had the sausage and mash and veggie haggis and mash, plus the thistle cross cider and twisted thistle IPA. It was amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom

9-huGR4bcFiubWtITzVqdA.text: First day in Scotland. Scottish food is awesome! who knew. Vegetarian Haggis. Couldn't bring myself to try the real stuff. Maybe when they come out with haggis ice cream.

UUHuqtzW3wwssoNv7njVpQ.text: So good! I had a hard time deciding what kind of sausage and mash combo I wanted to make because they all sounded so good! I loved the food and I felt really welcomed which was really nice as I was traveling solo. I will definitely go again when I am in Edinburgh.

JWE37kQHB3UNPqa72TVa_A.text: We came here for dinner on a Friday night. It was really busy and we didn't have a reservation, but the staff made it happen for us. We only waited about 10 minutes at the bar. The bar tender/waitress recommended the hard apple cider while we were waiting, it tasted really good. I had the wild boar sausages with the black pudding mash and the hubby had the grilled chicken with cheese and chive mash. They were both delicious. The sausages were so flavorful and meaty. The chicken was tender and juicy. The mash was silky and tasty with nice black pudding texture. The cheese and chive mash was really good as well. I had the sticky toffee pudding with a glass Balvenie whisky to complete the meal. The pudding was so fluffy in texture and so fragrant in taste, it was probably the best sticky toffee pudding I've had. The whisky had a nice fruity notes and it went well with the sweetness of the dessert.   It was a wonderful dining experience. I definitely recommend this place and would love to come back again when visiting Edinburgh.

photos.caption: Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Sticky toffee pudding with whisky
Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Grilled chicken with cheese and chive Mash
Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Wild boar sausage with black pudding Mash

mi_HkCcCzYO4orTvJ0b98w.text: The food here was incredibly delicious! We ordered the haggis with bacon mash, and the smoked sausage with this incredible mustard mash. We received a heaping proportion of both, and they were delicious. The smoked sausage came with this tart cream and crisp radish slaw, which really cut down on the heaviness. Our waitress was very sweet and gave us great service, and took her time to explain the menu when she saw that we were tourists with little experience with Scottish food. I'd recommend this restaurant with anyone.

HP-KF5BU7qTiGVBVG5tqVA.text: Out on vacation with my wife and her parents and we were coming back from the Scotch Whisky Experience wanting to grab a small bite. We came across this restaurant and was pleasantly surprised.   We ordered Mini Haggis (national dish of Scotland), Beef Short Ribs and Smoked Sausages. The main entrees comes with "Mash" which you get to choose how your potatoes are cooked. My favorite Mash was the cheese/chive Mash. The butter/cream mash was good if you want a clean taste and the roasted crispy potato skin was too hard for my liking.  Based off taste alone, you wouldn't know what the Haggis is made of. It was good and I would recommend not finding out until you have tried the dish. The Beef Short Ribs were tender and tasteful but had slight fat around it. The Smoke Sausages were great as we ordered another dish after having it.  Small complaints: 1) Table was really sticky... Every part of my side was untouchable.  2) I should have asked for more ice to go with my coke. I'm sure the server would have brought me some more.

bdiI-6t1CMc4ieA9lC-19w.text: So happy we found this place on yelp on our first night in Edinburgh.   The staff was very friendly & helpful.   One off us is vegetarian & the other a meat eater,  this place hit the mark for both of us.  The tomato soup starter was very tasty.  We got the vegetarian haggis & the chicken.   You get to choose what mash or rosti base you want to your main course.   We had the cheesy potato mash with the chicken & the herb rosti.  Both were incredibly delicious.  I'd recommend making a reservation as it can get very busy.  We'll definitely be coming back soon!

cOh1u0ljX_CjDMA1xh-nRA.text: This place does not disappoint.  Great food,  you would be sad to not have stopped and grabbed a bite.  Locally owned, supporting local businesses.  Does not get more authentic that this.

oqLh-3uCwO0FakoXh9qmzg.text: I intended to have a late lunch/early dinner on my way to the train station. But sadly this was not to be. When I arrived at 15:30 I was informed that they were only serving desserts and drinks. As I was tired and hungry I opted for the sticky toffee pudding and a black coffee.   The coffee was lovely, the pudding was okay except it wasn't very warm - I prefer my ice cream to melt on top. Whilst dining I checked the venue website and couldn't find any times for lunch and dinner menus. As if I'd known that hot food wasn't served for a couple of hours I could have planned my trip differently.

photos.caption: Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Americano
Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Sticky toffee pudding

B45HXYElMjNuHNYWay20qg.text: Food was fantastic, and our waiter was super friendly. Nuff said. We're just here on tour but it was without a doubt the best meal I've had since we arrived.

9DvktHIH8B4V4qx-9_Vx-A.text: Food was delicious ! We had the regular haggis and the vegetarian haggis. Both tastes amazing. The mash potatoes were also delicious.

8gWI19ffFHLESWqlGtkznQ.text: We came across this restaurant after a morning visit to the Edinburgh castle. It had quite a bit of locals having lunch so we thought it would be a good spot to stop for lunch too. I like that they had a mini version of haggis to try as an appetizer for first time tasters of haggis. I really enjoyed it and got the lunch portion with gravy for my main dish. I chose the black pudding mash to go with it.   The restaurant is delicious, clean and friendly. Definitely recommend.

9avnrirqcv8dTVouqlsG6w.text: My girlfriend came here twice it was so good. First time we got the haggis starter. Was great. My girlfriend had the vegetarian option. I had the beef and mash. Delicious. She had the egg plant and mash. The second time we came back we had the sticky toffee pudding. The staff are very friendly, knowledgeable and have great customer service. Would definitely recommend!

bVuH7BfzToYwwWjSyZCdxQ.text: We went here based on the Yelp reviews and we were not disappointed. The food is delicious and we will definitely come back again while we are in Edinburgh (I have to try the blood sausage). I had the haggis and the cheddar and chive mash. My husband had the gammon and classic mash. The turnip, haggis and mash combination was excellent - made me a haggis lover. The pork gammon was beautifully smoked and tender. Would definitely recommend you visit here.

photos.caption: Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Pork gammon, slaw and cranberry sauce. The pork was perfectly smoked and tender.
Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Haggis, puréed turnip and cheddar and chive mashed potatoes. Fantastic!

YAy8rh_Y44lBaBPDOvkc7A.text: Had the haggis mash. Was good. I would recommend taking a mash that is not meat heavy, like garlic, to blend the flavours better. Had the black pudding mash and the black pudding was dry in it.  The sausage egg and hash started was really good.  The ox cheek was tender but tasted earthy.  Would recommend taking only 2 plates per person, as they are way bigger than on yelp photos.

UneMi5SkvgmXkxNlWAcTrQ.text: Fantastic service by Adrianna, delicious food at a fair price. Highly recommended when in Edinburgh!

zqBeMiju0OJKjohQM4BfXA.text: Wonderful! Our meal at Makars was our favorite during our Scotland trip. My haggis, neeps and tatties was to die for. The gravy they put on it is out of this world. Try it with rhubarb cider! My companion also enjoyed her chicken very much. Service was prompt and very friendly. Would definitely recommend.

Tl-8mYbGZkWpi3nTGei7Ag.text: Incredibly tasty mash. Well seasoned and decadent, perfect for a flight recovery in from travel. Or an affordable might before a going out.  Fun,  young ambiance with a touch of Scottish literary amusement.  Wait staff really great,  patient and thoughtful,  great recommendation and knowledge of food.

photos.caption: Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Toffee pudding, put off this world,  duck and chicken wewe perfect, chicken is best for the whiskey cream sauce.

tJ2QZxP_jxKvTFbUryYcsg.text: Great place! Fresh locally sourced food, open casual atmosphere, good prices. Had the haggis and it was fabulous! Flavorful, not dry at all, placed on top of your choice of mash ( I picked chive and cheese) and topped with turnip puree and a nice peppercorn sauce. Friendly attentive service. Coming back to try the wild boar sausages next.

photos.caption: Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom

_BXhGzswM-r8jFnghJ45yg.text: Great staff and somehow even better food. Modern take on classic dishes. Smoked sausage with the blood pudding mash was out of this world. No matter the wait, worth a trip here. 100%

-bS4tT2BQWLyeyIIQYRNYg.text: Lovely staff, and so cosy on a cold day!  We were chilled to the bone after a day at the zoo, so here was a welcome place to sit.   Super lovely staff, nice range of drinks, and just lovely food. Stovies for starter, which really warmed me up, well seasoned and perfectly cooked, melt in the mouth meat and we both had the mussels for main, served in a big pot with excellent rustic bread, and they were lovely, quite possibly some of the best i've had, and in a really rather large good portion, especially with the value for money! Definitely a fan.

photos.caption: Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom

T3rosFaV5e14iPRGJJG46Q.text: This was definitely the best meal I had in Edinburgh out of more than a dozen places I visited during the course of one week. The lamb shank was "fall off the bone" tender and came with delicious bacon mashed potatoes. The house salad was also very good with a delicious mustard vinagerette. The service was also incredible. When the kitchen mistakenly sent my salad to another table, one of the waitresses apologized many times, gave me a big discount, and rushed my dinner. Another salad and lamb shank appeared about 5 minutes later. The view over the Princes Street Gardens and proximity to Edinburgh Castle are other pluses. I highly recommend you check out this place.

jK-JUwbYRsQVHmGWgAGG6w.text: Great little place, very helpful friendly staff, nice selection of mash to go with any meal selection.  Recommendations, lamb shank, roasted chicken and the sticky pudding.  Split the side salad, huge.

photos.caption: Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom

VB3GQg73wzoTd6M-7w4epQ.text: First time visitor to Scotland and the Makara mash bar. I ordered the Ox main course with the Scottish cheddar mash, it was quite good. Service is top notch and friendly. I would come here again and also recommend to any of my friends.  Excellent food, service, and location.

photos.caption: Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Yummy beer
Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Ox dish

wYm4hgNM_A-E2B-QnvfDiw.text: We had an amazing dinner here.  The roast chicken was superb.  I eat a lot of chicken and it is #1 on the best that I have ever had.  It's too bad that I had to come thousands of miles for the pleasure of their food. :). Oh, and don't miss the sticky toffee pudding!  Sorry that the picture of this was taken after I had already tasted. WOW!

photos.caption: Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom

Pdk-Ya4UD2Y3DxERKSKAeA.text: This place is excellent. The food is consistently good, the beer is cold, wine is available and the whiskey is poured a little bigger than most pubs.  I have had most of the mains, I had the roast gammon last night and it was delicious. The mash bar part of the name comes from the side of mashed potatoes the meat is placed on. There are different renderings of the mashed 'tatties' and they are good. I also recommend the haggis starter.   Come summer you will need a reservations. It's not a big place and tables go quickly. Also, if you arrive late your menu choices may be limited as they run out of roasts.

VOrsdLLDV25nA6E93HjOcw.text: The Bonnie Prince Charlie Chicken and the "MINI HAGGIS, NEEPS & TATTIES TASTER" (I substituted Vegetarian Haggis; the turnips are mashed with heather honey) were extraordinary. (The mashed potatoes taste just like mashed potatoes on the lighter/healthier side, which worked fine with the robust flavors of everything else and are a very good balance to the richness of the signature chicken.) The seasonal side salad with pickled vegetable garnish (which I got without added dressing) was one of the most delicious salads I have ever tasted. Dessert looked extraordinary as well, but no room for it. (Ate at the Mound location.) I do need to take a point off for a crap cup of tea -- watery and tasteless. I can't imagine what happened. But everything else was so amazing that it still rounds up to 5 stars.

GM3RLrpYdHnS4uAR3irBwA.text: Absolutely loved this place, from the haggis and skins to the bangers and mash to the sticky toffee pudding. Good portions for the price too. Food was delicious and the service was great.

T54bis2VZy-A-kFqKjJwBw.text: Delicious veggie (vegan and vegetarian) options, friendly service, welcoming to travelers, not too pricy either! Get the vegetarian haggis with the cheese chive mash--it's absolutely exceptional

J4PB4yRNE-n4ck52vgdZVg.text: Okay, this may well be the best haggis in Edinburgh. I highly recommend choosing the black pudding mash to go with it. It comes with a whiskey, peppercorn, wholegrain mustard & cream sauce which is absolutely delectable.  Service can be a bit hit or miss, which is the only reason I gave it 4 instead of 5 stars (it's usually pretty good, but there is occasionally a bit of a petulant attitude when they're busy).   Warning! They are often booked up for dinner during summer--even on a weekday--so making a reservation is highly recommended for dinner time seatings.

photos.caption: Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Haggis with Black-pudding Mash
Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Menu

_KyIrQxyXvgsg6m-j6R2Kw.text: Very tasty Haggis for a fair price. Recommend for everyone who needs a quick bite. Good service and cozy interior. Beef and sausage combos were both amazing as well. Prepare to leave this place with a full stomach, ready to continue exploring Edinburgh.

nDORbyaUqyRcnEXZa-w_Vg.text: From 14 year old to 77 year old we all loved our meals! Get the lamb shank or the skirt steak for sure!! Any and all mashes are recommended!  You cannot go wrong...a great selection of whiskey as well.  Perfectly Scottish!

fr4XJp3UGxmKOpWmva2SZA.text: After a week in Edinburgh we can say it is the best food in town! Also the service is top! We will come back.  Nach einer Woche in Edinburgh konnen wir sagen, dass es hier das beste Essen der Stadt gibt. Auch der Service ist topp! Wir kommen wieder.  PS: Haggis schmeckt hier gut, wenn man Pflonz bzw. Himmel und Ad mag.

photos.caption: Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom

hP0hxHveFVKhkGP0XO03jQ.text: We enjoyed our lunch here very much. It was crowded but we were able to be seated right away. It did take some time to get our food, but I think that was because they had a lot of orders at one time. Just one of those things- everybody wants to eat between noon and 1:00 pm, right?  I had the grilled chicken breast with a whiskey mustard sauce over the classic mashed potatoes. Delicious. My son had the wild boar sausages and my husband had the haggis. Everybody was pleased with their meal and felt that the portion sizes were perfect.

bTXh3AgozLyBfPIjtXNbIg.text: Amazing food and generous portions for a great price. If you're not feeling up to mash they also have some great alternatives such as the scotch egg with rosti which I highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom

9GgQu9tM7hiIFGAYSTJYJQ.text: Great service. The mini haggis was delicious as well as several other dishes. They have several choices of alcohol available. There food is reasonably priced and well worth the wait. Would recommend. Last note, they don't accept Amex.

Kc4TrFB9a9R9nP9Ml_IWjg.text: The English/Scottish food was great! Not very big, but busy in early May. Pretty tight seating, but we found this to be common in the UK....

9plrZo7dEcavdSOeN8CCSg.text: Excellent place to get food in Edinburgh! It has an amazing view of the Princes Street Gardens and a great drinks menu. We got the lamb shank and the duck, both of which were some of the best food I've had in a very long while. They also have amazing mashed potatoes. If you go I definitely recommend the chives and cheddar potatoes because frankly they're like eating a piece of heaven. Also, if you're trying to get away from the tourists but want to stay in a central area, this is the spot for you

dIKiUaC0Vy2-AfCGe-1FXg.text: This restaurant was absolutely delicious!!! I ordered the peppercorn mustard chicken dish with the bacon onion mashers. It was so good, I could have ate two entres. The host was super friendly and our waitress Kirstie was so nice and great. I will definitely return here if I ever come back to Scotland!

jNo8L6Uj_hz9kNWKHZsnQg.text: I had the whiskey chicken and the crispy bacon and scallion mash. The chicken was fantastic and perfectly cooked and tender. The mash was awesome. The seasonal veggie was beets. I was apprehensive at first, but they were delicious. They seemed to have a "mulled cinnamon" flavor. My husband got the haggis with honey and turnip puree. He said it was five stars. We topped it off with the toffee pudding and caramel sauce. Five stars again! It was actually semi-gooey cake with toffee sauce throughout and caramel sauce underneath-with a scoop of ice cream. We left happy!

photos.caption: Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom. The menu March 2018
Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Haggis and potato mains
Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom

JpFV82gE3vr-GQdyqwK6cw.text: Haggis is excellent here, and the lamb shank is probably the best thing I ate in Scotland (followed closely by their haggis!).  Only downside was the service here - seemed not only slow, but just not motivated to help or make recommendations.  Also, be sure to tell your server to put all food orders in at once (appetizers and mains), as otherwise you will wait 45 min to get your main.  Would definitely go again.  Great food!

5Qaw7KmX5sBQRyVrQiMWTw.text: Fabulous! I had the lamb shank and it was done perfectly. There was also a order of duck confit and was good also a. The mashed potatoes are a treat! I sampled the mustard style and the horseradish sauce style. Both were equally good and worth getting again. Friendly staff and relaxed atmosphere worth it if you have the time and are in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom

Y_YJs-kkBoWGWjep3EMEBQ.text: I went to this place while on vacation and it was good. The atmosphere is casual but nice. You should get a reservation even if it's not full. Seems this town really prefers reservations. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Lots of smiles! The carrot soup was to die for! We got two different mash dishes (lamb and beef) and they were tasty but pretty salty. If you shy away from salt or too much sodium then it's not for you. But we had an overall pleasant experience.

SrRbEDtBwOhn-T6lSViLJA.text: This is an excellent restaurant! The best food we have eaten in Edinburgh. The haggis was so good that my teenage daughters loved it! The lamb with black pudding mash was delicious!

NhGfKD83YIKs-tBV7S7K1Q.text: I stopped in without reservation and was very friendly greeted by one if the waitstaff to be sat anyway. Throughout my meal it was a combined team effort by the three employees to help me, and they were all more than willing and kind!   I got a cider and haggis, because when you visit Scotland you have to have haggis at least once. Well, it was absolutely amazing, and a large enough portion served with mashed potatoes (I got cheddar and chive), that you don't go hungry (: I suggest to anyone passing through Edinburgh to give this place a go, definitely worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom

WXWV8Y0Tstua3k4Rhm5krw.text: This is a go to. We saw this on youtube as a local recommendation, the place is really small and casual. I had the haggis and cheese and chive mash. Amazing! Great service and not expensive at all! The seating is limited so you have to get in quickly!

9KzG6cus6yKVFBv9P9XNrg.text: Food and beer was delicious. Staff was very friendly; the ambience of the place is very welcoming. Glad we stopped in, recommend grabbing a Belhaven Black if you're a Guinness fan.

eeWuVxxFWs2PpxGf8wYZDA.text: We came here as part of the Eat Walk Edinburgh food tour but it was a great stop! Very happy we got to come by here as I was introduced to two great items. 1) Black Pudding AKA Blood Sausage and 2) Edinburgh Gin. The black pudding was surprisingly tasty and wasn't expecting to like it, but I did! And then we had a the Edinburgh Gin in the Raspberry flavor mixed with prosecco and it was the perfect little cocktail. Really great stuff. Seems like a very nice place to come for a full meal. If we had more time I would have tried to stop back.

photos.caption: Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom

7qIWjFiW1EUjToL-36RYVg.text: How could you go wrong? Potatoes, meat, cheese! We all had something a little different and everyone enjoyed their meal. Haggis was flavorful and had a good texture.

yB1wRjyEYuyLoqPRW0IXpg.text: A delicious trendy find! Lots of great mash, good options for vegeterians. I got the portobello mushroom on shredded friend potatoes, and was very impressed. However, the MOST AMAZING DISH was a dessert: Sticky Toffee Pudding. For any of the clueless like me, pudding is actually a cake. A cake that is HEAVEN.  Waitstaff is very personable too!

1VFQ6WLsVX5Vp2j3GD0KxA.text: Scottish Beef Haggis with Heather Honey & Turnip Puree and Sticky Toffee Pudding with Butterscotch sauce.   Soft, warm and Too good !!  Service was excellent as well

kpGxe1J3_Ia1ifI8HUkAcg.text: I love this place! The food is amazing, and for such a great price. I had the duck confit with cheddar and chive mash and it was PERFECT. The meat fell right off the bone. Overall it was a great Scottish experience with amazing Scottish food! Cheers!

photos.caption: Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Duck Confit w/ Cheddar Chive Mash

TdB9pvgMoVLF8NzxobvmWw.text: Loved this place.  Loved the concept.  Very simple.  Pick your mash.  We all chose different things so could share.  Very friendly staff, they went out of their way to make sure we were seated on a busy night.  Good desserts.  Great location.  Must try!

nct_8gQzBPE_AHmo8k8R-w.text: We came here on a weekday around 6pm without a reservation and were seated immediately.   First time eating haggis. Mini haggis was an excellent dish and I really liked it with the turnip and potato and a great sampler to see if you like this Scottish cuisine.   Ox cheek with blood sausage mashed potatoes also fantastic. Ox cheek very soft. Hard to taste the blood sausage since it was mixed into the mashed potatoes.   Fries with haggis was decent. I prefer the mini haggis because I couldn't really taste the haggis with the fries.   Solid dishes here to try Scottish dishes. Unfortunately I didn't get to try the Scottish eggs because they ran out.

photos.caption: Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Ox cheek sausage
Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Potatoes with blood sausage
Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Mini haggis

ne9Exhh9fOtM2w49dW-gyA.text: During our visit to Edinburgh we stumbled upon Makars - A cozy little place to have excellent Scottish food at a very reasonable price! Casual atmosphere and with pretty good options for food.  We had SCOTCH EGG to start, which was scrumptious. I ordered Makars Wild Boar Sausage in onion Gravy and my wife ordered Bonnie Prince Charlie Char grilled Chicken in a Whisky Peppercorn & Mustard Sauce. All meals come with a nice heap of mash (mashed potato) with a few favor options. Mash was excellent, felt Chicken had better flavor profile compared to Sausage and the Whisky sauce was delicious. Overall, amazing flavors, fantastic experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom

DvYj6GiE-6vd7kPTh4aHPA.text: Wow!!! Great place!  Our family voted this place a unanimous 5 out of 5 Stars! We had to wait about an hour to be seated but it turned out to be really worth it! Most of us had a variation of their several Sausages and Mash Dishes (the Traditional, the Wild Boar Sausage, the Beef & Black Pudding Sausage) - all really good. Was surprised to find that the Beef & Black Pudding Sausage was actually the tastiest of the three. My wife had the Peppercorn Mustard Chicken which was equally tasty, and my other son had the Honey Soaked Smoked Gammon and Mash which he Loved(!)... (see our pics of the various dishes).  We learned Gammon is like a cured slab of Ham, in this case basted with honey & served w/cranberry sauce. Very Tasty! We also got to taste Haggis!!! Our waitress - Sasha, (who was Awesome by the way!) Recommended we order a "Childs Portion" which was much lower cost than the full-size entre, just so we could all sample the (Mustard Peppercorn Beef) Haggis. We did, and it worked out perfectly! Tasty dish in spite of the 'graphic list of ingredients'! Drinks were also great... had a Pint of "Twisted Thistle" IPA from 'Bellhaven Brewery' and my son had a Hollyrood Pale Ale from the same brewery. Both good... I actually liked his Pale better! We ordered Dessert as well and we were not disappointed! Scotch Pudding was great... we also had Brownie & Ice Cream and a Mango Sherbet. All very tasty. And the service was stellar! Great departure night dinner at Makars! They earned their 5-Star rating.   :-)

photos.caption: Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Beef Haggis with Heather Honey and Turnip Puree
Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Wild Boar Sausage and Smoked Bacon Mash
Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Honey-Soaked Smoked Gammon with Smoked Bacon Mash

OxsvBnfn10S-IT_u4KTY_A.text: Great food, really happy I found this place. Everything we ordered was delicious & the staff was really helpful and friendly. I think this was one of the best meals we had in our 3 day stay in Edinburg.

yjRfCwE2JpPGuIny-Y0fIA.text: After a long walk in the Old Town part of Edinburgh we were both hungry and cold. Where to go?   After about 5 minutes of Yelping me and my boyfriend had decided to eat at the, according to yelp, enormously popular and delicious Makars Gourmet Mash Bar.  We entered and it was completely full. A deal was made with the waitress and she gave us a device that would buzz when a table was free and we waited at a nearby pub. We were told it would take 45 minutes. With 30 minutes to go to the 45 minute deadline the buzzer started buzzing. We left our half-finished Guinness pints and went back next door to the Mash bar.  Makars Mash Bar is, as you can guess, a restaurant which specializes on mash.  First you choose your meat. We went for Honey-Glazed Gammon Steak and Brisket with Mushroom Gravy.   Then you choose your mash. The Gammon was paired with Bacon and Spring Onion Mash and the Beef with Butter and Cream Mash.  The food was amazing. Especially considering that the restaurant is a mix between a fast food joint and a restaurant.   Why only 3 stars? We were seated near the steps down to the basement where the toilets were located. And terrible smells kept on coming up from the basement. A total mood-killer.  Go here, get a table near the entrance and indulge in creamy, rich and delicious mash

photos.caption: Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom

WtZQznl_bYeshdyzVmD7_A.text: Went for the reviews, will be. Back for the food. haggis and Scotch eggs for starters. The mains elevated it. Nice local beer to wash it down  Can't wait to make it back here.

eLpd8YD8xn9NJGAPUXYckQ.text: We had Roosti stacks, which were like potato cakes with meat and cheese on top. They were delicious! Even with a half-point of beer, the total was less than 25 for two people. Great deal and fantastic food.

photos.caption: Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Shredded pork Rotti with slaw and salad.

4aIM8QcCJup8bpAk_Tad6g.text: Best food in Edinburgh. Ate here two nights in a row and every meal was amazing and full of flavor. The prices are very reasonable for great food. Staff are super friendly. Definitely worth the trip.

photos.caption: Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Coffee panna cotta with chocolate sauce and almonds
Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Drambuie chicken with bacon and chives mash
Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Confit duck with orange glaze. Fell right off the bone.

s5RQMmFwEt0A63kZX04rnw.text: Cozy atmosphere, great music plus a kind and energetic staff. The food was amazing!! Best I've had in Edinburgh so far!! Will definitely return, maybe even for dinner tonight.

photos.caption: Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom

RXx3VQMpmNX51sxs44ILlg.text: My family and I are visiting Edinburgh through a tour company named Globus. For the most part in our trip around the British Isles, we've been fed similar foods, buffets, etc. This changed our perception of how we think of UK/SCOTTISH food. I ordered the Gammon with Black Pudding. I've never had pork so tender and pretty. The black mud pudding, which was inside the mash, was surprisingly tasteful. It had a spice to it. My mom and sister both ordered the Chicken, also tender and delicious. The table decided to order the chocolate toffee with ice cream. The toffee was delicious and the restaurant was great. Friendly staff, cool environment, 5 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Gammon
Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Toffee

JVqCMrqzlbG1cmYWkavAIQ.text: This food was amazing. I had the lamb shank and the gammon. Both were delicious, the Gammon was Devine. I have never seen Gammon in the US so it was more of a gamble, it's a smoked pork steak and the smokiness was turkey wonderful.  Closed it up with Sticky Toffee Pudding, another dish not found in the US, and its heavenly. It kinda tastes like a toasted March mellow, but it's not marshmallow at all.

photos.caption: Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom

2Wh0GKhdf5w_wJ0vr9mg_w.text: Amazing! I normally dont go all "fan boy" for food but the sausage and cheese/chive mash blew my mind!! Awesome

wBklIG91h2vEc2se8OTX5Q.text: This place was so good! We had a large group of about 16 and they met all of our needs perfectly. We had to sit at different tables, but that was not a problem!

UwHkS8qqyk_p2FWl17mtyA.text: Great food and vibe environment! Great prices and high quality food. Staffs are friendly, and I'll recommend this place to anyone who wants to have a dinner! Scottish eggs are perfect to try out!

photos.caption: Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom

ELcuELnbXNLeT1uOndW14w.text: Great service, Great Location, Great Food,Great Music , Great Server, Great Host and Bartender. We enjoyed it immensely!!

0QGJAiFejC7ti5nt7XpJ2A.text: Such a great lunch stop!  If you're ever craving mashed potatoes, this is the place.  The wild boar sausage, Scottish cheddar and spring onion toppings made it perfect and kept me going the whole afternoon.

zC336LmTQspIKIP9zRKW9g.text: I loved the wild boar sausage! It paired well with the various types of mash available! Also the skirt steak was perfectly cooked! The proportion of mash-to-meat in both dishes was wonderful! According to a fellow diner, "BEER GOOD", which is quite a complement! He clearly likes it! For dessert, the sticky toffee pudding, accompanied by home-made ice cream, was a fantastic closure to the best meal we've yet had in Scotland!  The service was impeccable! They held my fellow diners' and my reservations an hour late, as we had missed our train due to a delay! Every second we waited for our train, we daydreamed about this stellar restaurant!   10/10 it  is recommended

qx7iKCNCkbU_duK4O5JCuQ.text: We were drawn to this spot because of the good reviews and the vegetarian options... and of course, haggis.  I had the vegetarian skirlie. It was quite good. A nice portion of veg sausages with a lovely cream sauce-- sitting on a mound of scrumptious mashed potatoes. I highly recommend the horseradish ones.  Also in our group was someone with a sulphite sensitivity, and the server (Adam, I think) went above and beyond to make sure that person's food was safe.

Xe6XiTnM_75cmeDdguekxw.text: Secret tip: the vegetarian haggis and sausages are actually the same thing but shaped and cooked slightly differently. I opted for the sausages as they were supposed to be less 'mushy'.   Best veggie sausages ever? No, not quite. But they were good enough. Mash was decent but nothing spectacular. I was a bit disappointed that it only came with a bit of gravy and coleslaw.   My partner's gammon, while tasty, came as a thick slab which made is difficult to cut and eat. He would have preferred thinner slices.   That said, great selection on the menu. Something for everyone! And fun lively environment too.

NrywAT3MYRBFEtvurikP4g.text: The main restaurant was busy so we tried the 'express version' at the corner. Food was still very good, though they microwaved it, haha.   I added the smoked sausage and cheddar cheese to the normal beef Haggis and it was great.

photos.caption: Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom

3XEx90HqI_VfvOJDzUJjyQ.text: Thanks to the Yelp Community for helping me and my friends find this fantastic dinner spot. It was very crowded when we arrived but we were given a pager and told we could go next door to the bar and have a drink while waiting for our table.  When seated we ordered a Scotch Egg appetizer (delicious) then went on to a different Mash for each of us. We ordered the beef haggis (A perfect introduction for someone who is never had it and afraid to try it), the Beef Skirt Mash and the Bonnie Prince Chicken Mash. All were outstanding and flavor and the portions were very generous. For dessert we split a Sticky Toffee Pudding Cake, the perfect sweet ending for an indulgent meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Skirt Steak mash
Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Beef Haggis
Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Toffee Pudding

oR6Iv3iDBJRu5ADoNiESbg.text: Mash potatoes.  Want them done right?  I know that I was day 2 in Scotland, and suddenly I got a ravenous craving for mash potatoes.  My gal and I were hungry and I was thinking what could I get thats above average in country.  I landed on sausage and mash potatoes.  Also called, "Bangers and Mash" in Great Britain.  We asked around and Makars was the spot.  we ran out of the pub we were in and went straight to the Makars near us.  we came in about a half hour before they closed.  I asked if we could eat and the gal working the front said probably not, in a depressing way.  we said "really, ok", and walked out.   We stood outside and asked each other if that was common to just not serve 30 minutes before closing.... We waked in and said "we are ordering" and she said ok, but that we would have to order soon, and we agreed.  It had become clear to us she was just not trying.   When we got our order it made up for the shoddy service.  The mash potatoes(what they are known for), were fantastic.  The wild boar that came with mine was incredible as well.  juicy. robust and full of spice.   We were so happy we had gone in a second time to insist on dinner.  It was a great and hearty meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Wild boar sausage and onion and crispy sMoked bacon mash!
Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom. A dram of scotch

ES9F5Z0aGokbc53BoMKzVQ.text: It's everything they say it is!  We took a chance because they do not take reservations and went to dinner at 7:00. At that point there were 8 tables ahead of us, but we went to the bar next door to wait. The wait was about 45 minutes...worth it!  The atmosphere is cozy and all about the food! I had the chicken and sour cream chives and onion mash. Ridiculously tasty!   Our servers were funny, helpful and good at making suggestions. Our food was served steaming and quickly!  We have never had Sticky Toffee Pudding so we decided to try theirs and now I'm depressed we will not be able to get it in the states. Theirs literally melted in our mouth like cotton candy. So good!   We almost went back for a second night but we got out to late and thought we would not be able to get a table. Get there early or you may not get a table! This was our favorite restaurant In Edinburgh.

photos.caption: Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Chicken and Cheddar Chive Mash

ygQyfkWAs7CMZk--HkUG5A.text: Yelp and Trip Advisor were spot on with all the great reviews of this place -- only a stone's throw from The Castle. Casual atmosphere yet fabulous food -- best place we went to in Scotland for AUTHENTIC SCOTTISH FOOD at a very reasonable price. Pick your main which comes with one of the many versions of their "Mash" (potatoes) 1. Haggis Starter -- came with mash and parsnips -- not strong at all -- a good "introduction" to haggis which you have to try. Tastes like minced beef with spices.  10/10 2. Lamb Shank - Falling of the bone tender with mild spices -- this dish was a real winner with a generous portion. 9/10 3. Honey Soaked Gammon - their version of ham but BETTER. 9/10 4. Desert - Sour Cherry Cake with White Chocolate Ice Cream (we usually get Sticky Toffee Pudding but was told this is the one to get here -- and it was amazing! 10/10 -- Don't pass this up!  Too bad we were only in Edinburgh for two days as I could eat here regularly -- HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

photos.caption: Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Desert Menu (May &#39;19)
Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Lamb Shank
Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Haggis Starter

ErLOLo0R8yO83Q31QTMRZw.text: We loved happily stumbling into Makars while being on a short stay in Edinburgh. If you go, you want to ask for 'David'- he helped us through the menu for different types of food and ales and we had a great time. We had wanted to come back another day to try the Scotch Eggs since the day we were there they were out- bud sadly we didn't make it.

uRR_bhJlGd3363QXlYjR6A.text: Fantastic food, friendly service, cozy decor -- really just great vibes all around. Friends and I came by on a weekday evening post watching the sunset (right nearby has great views!) and ordered a number of entrees: the lamb shank, oxtail, sausage, and gammon. The four of us also split an order of the potato skins -- so hot and tasty. The meat was just incredible -- perfectly tender (the lamb was, at least) with a really nice tangy tomato sauce to pair. The star of the show was the mash though -- highly recommend the chive and cheddar!  We all split a sticky toffee pudding at the end, and quite honestly, if you're going to order anything here, have this be it. Hands down the best thing I've tasted, anywhere.  The dessert that shows up every other. Please please swing by this place for a visit if you're near!

photos.caption: Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Sticky toffee pudding
Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Lamb Shank

7TCJC0SRd_8WpvYAO0CJDg.text: Yum! Lots of choices. When I went after sightseeing on Royal Mile, I popped in here and there was no wait. I wanted to try haggis and it was pretty good! I ate the whole thing. It comes in a peppercorn whisky sauce. I'm sure that helped with the taste. I ordered a salad too. They didn't have Scotch eggs. Ran out that day. They play good (American) music and it has a good atmosphere. The windows face a busy street so you can peoplewatch. It is probably halfway up on the hill so you have a nice view below and all around. Prices are good.

fbEzzA5VTKOoPRax_3YK7w.text: My wife and I were a 2 person walk in before military tattoo. Superb food, great drink selection, and efficient service. Would definitely return.

CekqfaQPTdcZ73LKfjEfHw.text: We took a day trip from London to visit historic Edinburgh. I wanted to find an authentic Scottish eatery for a late lunch before beginning our journey back to London. We were drawn to this spot because of the 5 star reviews we discovered on Yelp.   The previous raters were absolutely correct. The food was great. I had the "Slow Cooked Beef Skirt" and I had the "Bonnie Prince Charlie Chargrilled Chicken". My wife said it was the most tender beef she had ever eaten.   Our  service team of Macha, Andriama, Callie and Adam were  fantastic and took the time to explain the menu choices to us. They kept are glasses full but didn't rush us out and gave us a chance to slowly enjoy our second pint of "Stewart's Lager".  A very fine brew by the way.      It's a bit of a climb up the hill from Waverley Station but trust me the food is worth the climb.   I recommend making a booking if you plan to dine after 18:00. It began crowding as we finished our visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Walking in the door.

KlY-B6MOFwPu1-kdjR0vyA.text: We were absolutely delighted with everything we ate. "Exceeded expectations" is putting it far too lightly. Great service, superb food. If I'm ever in Edinburgh again, I will absolutely return.

photos.caption: Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom. I got haggis with the mustard mash and my partner got bangers and mash with the cheddar/chive mash. Both were unbelieveable!!!
Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom. The accompanying sauces are what make these next-level good
Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom. A positively divine bite

js0xTCEWZvP7g3qiqfbYGQ.text: A fantastic place for our first meal in Scotland! Very convenient to the Royal Mile. We had two appetizers, haggis and the crowdie salad. This was our first haggis and it tasted just fine, like a good meatball. My husband had beer and I was happy they had Thistly Cross cider. Our main meals were sausage (for my husband) and orange duck. Again, everything was great. I've never seen my husband enjoy mashed potatoes so much! He thought the horseradish mash was incredible. Really, we found this place well worth the acclaim.

photos.caption: Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom. wild boar sausage
Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom. mini haggis, neeps, and tatties
Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom. confit duck leg

Qat0SZD5fWBthBU-GvUmXw.text: Thank you, Yelpers! Yet again, a tasty experience I probably never would have stumbled upon had it not been for finding the reviews of this eatery located an alley/block removed from The Royal Mile hustle and bustle. We were curious about the "mash" menu and had to experience it for ourselves. The mashes are smashed potato variations ranging from chive and cheddar to horseradish that paired beautifully with entrees like pot roast (crazy tender- the star of the show at our table).   In addition to the pot roast, we ordered the rhubarb soda (locally made and delicious), honey carrot soup, beets and local cheese salad, and a variety of the mashes. The horseradish was my favorite. The waitress was very sweet and friendly and you could tell this business was passionate about sharing their story and highlighting local Scottish farmers and producers through the clever layout of the menu. If you're looking for a spot outside, they have three or four picnics tables available under the tree. This ended up being one of our favorite meals during our time in Scotland.

1JAylr0HPp_lT2gIUDzDxg.text: Totally recommend this place for Scottish food! I ate Haggis here for the 1st time and totally loved it. Great service, nice decor and the food was amazing!

On3W23kjcqM_TivZ8IaGsg.text: Visited this place based on yelp reviews. It did not disappoint. I ordered the half chicken with cheddar potatoes. It was soooo good. My mashed potato expectations are now a lot higher! My husband had the haggis and loved it.....wasn't really for me, but still excellent! Definitely try this place out! So many choices.

IlVHWW2QgRM3JkPG9q9ddQ.text: Good for dietary restrictions and classic Scottish food. Also a cool environment to enjoy a meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Vegetarian option

RRcjKvcud3HMcH1wGQBuQQ.text: Came here around 7pm on a Thursday night and had to wait ten minutes for a table of two. Staff was very friendly and helpful.  This is a great modern place for Scottish food and local beer. The portions were big and delicious. Would highly recommend for anyone going to Edinburgh.

photos.caption: Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Haggis and Mash

uap5q2uj7rTe2cvifvGliw.text: Great restaurant! Everything tasted great and the service was good as well. They have a haggis appetizer which allows you to try a small portion of it if this is something you haven't had before. It comes with both neeps and tatties with their whisky peppercorn sauce. The sauce is very good. I tried the whisky peppercorn chicken with their side salad. Both were really good. Other people at my table tried the mashes which they all enjoyed as well. Would definitely come here at least once!

photos.caption: Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Whisky peppercorn chicken
Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Haggis

W0M6vGUefwebJLMFTbS_UQ.text: The staff was very accommodating during a busy time. The lamb shank and cheese mash was excellent. Best meal we had in Edinburgh.

fazRGPrYARPzvAk9trxm_Q.text: My husband and I were in the mood to try some traditional Scottish food, so after some Yelp research, this place made my list of bookmarks. It was quite busy for mid-afternoon on a Tuesday, but we were able to get a table without a reservation; however, the service was a bit on the slower side. I should have known, being in the heart of the tourist area near The Royal Mile and castle, what I would likely be getting us into. The quality and taste of the food, in my opinion, is not worth the higher prices here. I ordered the lamb shank with spring onion and smoked sausage mash (I asked our server for their mash recommendation to pair with the lamb; I should have just picked myself, as I was disappointed that the sausage tasted quite a bit like hot dog). Parts of the lamb were tender and moist and others were dry and rough. I thought the Shiraz wine I selected paired well with the flavor of the lamb, which was mainly what I liked about my meal. My husband ordered the chicken with black pudding mash (just go with it, don't ask what's in it because it won't sound appetizing) and thought it was okay. The chicken was slightly overcooked (borderline dry) and didn't have much flavor to it. He enjoyed his IPA beer. The portions are pretty large and heavy. Overall, although this place seems overpriced, I'm glad we tried it for the novelty of having the opportunity to eat some traditional Scottish food; however, we weren't impressed and wouldn't return.

y9k0NX9jmUGU4P5v5-KFaA.text: Nice looking place but the service was super slow and food was really average. They are specialized to different types of mashed potatoes and those were the biggest dissapointments of the meal. We tried traditional and cheddar cheeze and both tasted the same. Ox cheek on the other hand was good.

YRsJ9S_OWVpZn9AiiOdUmA.text: Some of the best mashed potatoes I've ever had, the lamb shank was great, and the vegetarian options were also great. Our server Greta was kind and attentive. The restaurant had a nice atmosphere. I would definitely recommend coming here.

kcLMsneCsocygStxzoIxNw.text: Just outside Royal mile.  Great food.  Service was a little slow, I guess you could blame it on a shift change.  Had the haggis, turnip and mash and it was delicious.  Wife had the Prince Charles chicken and mash and it was good as well.  Would definitely visit again if we lived here.

Y6eElbk6Brrn7J5Pq0B2Cg.text: I ate here in July when some friends were visiting from the US and I wanted them to try haggis. We had their two course lunch meal (I think it was ~15 pp) and a nice glass of prosecco with strawberry puree. We started with smoked salmon and then had their version of haggis, neeps, and tatties for the main which was really delicious. The haggis was not overpowering and it was extremely high quality. The restaurant has a nice vibe, casual but 'upscale' enough for a special lunch and/or dinner. I will definitely be back!

svn5M-1vBDFF0q6Cx_u3aA.text: This place was absolutely great!  The food was awesome both times we went there and the beer was some of the best we had on our trip. The only issue we had was that it was closed twice when their business hours said open. We were sad we couldn't eat there again!

EkKSjjpQOlh_RiQxav28vQ.text: We found this place as we were coming up from the hop on hop off bus on Princes street. What a treat!!! we didn't know how it was going to be but the tripadvisor recommendation on the window helped...and boy we were not wrong!!! The steak here is one of the best we've had in Europe on this vacation, at a great price however, the star in this restaurant are the langustines. You should not miss them if you are a lover of shellfish. They are excellent, prepared with garlic and seasoning to perfection and then grilled. Oh my, Oh my, and they give you a good amount of them to enjoy. For dessert do not miss the classic English Toffee pudding!, you'll leave here a happy eater!. Out of 7 dinners in Edinburgh, we were here for 3 of them!. PS. Do not be put off my the blond girl's cool and frigid demeanor (like she doesn't give a s**t.) She is very professional albeit cool as a cucumber.

x4wBNcbmLWpi06IHKLIRlg.text: Giving this place 5 stars for their customer service. My boyfriend and I recently stopped in while on vacation in Edinburgh. We ordered 2 beers and potato skins. After finishing our beers sitting outside for about 30 minutes without getting our food, I asked one of the employees how much longer it would be. After checking in the kitchen, we told that our order seemed to have gotten lost in the kitchen. We were given an apology by one of the workers and offered 2 free pints for our inconvenience. Our food arrived 5 minutes later. Overall, good beers, good food, and great customer service.

_rmClBkBNQaGSKxYp3c1Gg.text: The ox meet's sooo good. It's very juicy and has a great taste. Highly recommend. Plus, the price's very reasonable.

9u8N2lEhlmuXn3yOHaxHaA.text: Lives up to its claims as being a independent place where you can have a great foodie experience.

ZTgIN1tQRSyP4k89MdW7EQ.text: Great meal with a friend. Excellent recommendations from the staff. Great chooses of mains and the mash was excellent.

FcvrSBYD9hVR1YLqebF3aA.text: This is a nice Scottish sit down restaurant with a few items on a lunch menu ranging 8-10 and a full bar with local specialty beers.   I have been here a few times, having a steak sandwich (very nice though slightly tough and small for the American palate), neaps and haggis (good if you like haggis), and stokkie. This has become a regular for nicer business lunch.   Just recently had the stokkie and was pleasantly surprised. Basically a soupy dish with potatoes, cabbage, and savory ham hock, and topped with a few slivers of steak. Very nice and something I'd come back again for (especially good for Scottish weather!).

photos.caption: Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Stokkies

SQOdRsSNGPlebxNxHHTBvw.text: Very good staff, great food, extremely vegan friendly and very reasonably priced!! Must go for everyone but if you are a vegetarian or vegan in Scotland definitely a must.

H31EiBfc4mdCoLieUKiDMw.text: Great place for vegetarians and meat eaters. Food was great, we had potato skins, veggie haggis and burger rosti. Portions were generous and the food tasted great. Service was on point. Would definitely make this a regular place if I lived in Edinburgh. Location is great, near the castle but away from the crowds.

fGPZlZ4xAU4Ie-pnBdvf_w.text: Awesome haggis. Clean to be Scotland's best and I believe it. Would go back and eat here in a minute. Wife had the smoked pork chop. Also excellent.

yMvqMswoThqWuUMdTIqJcg.text: Great place to stop for a bite. Creative dishes made with specialty mashed potatoes their thing. I only had starters but they were great! Tomato soup was fantastic with chunks of tomatoes and great flavor. Then I had the haggis skins and mist say their haggis is amazing! Very happy with my selections.

avj1aaTQSTty6I-jsjBhdA.text: This place is perfect! Stopped in with my family after walking the busy streets of the Royal Mile. We looked at so many spots that were either overpriced, too busy, or not busy at all (never a good sign) and finally stumbled across this restaurant for a 6pm Saturday dinner. Our party of 6 was seated right away and we had so many options from drinks to food. As a vegetarian I had a good amount of choices to pick from and my veggie sausage and rosti were so so so delicious. My dinner is of my favorite dishes to date because the whisky cream sauce was so rich and flavorful. My family loved the chicken, lamb, haggis, and the different mashes as well. Service was kind, friendly, and reasonably quick. Prices were good too for the quality and amount of food. Can't recommend this spot enough and shoutout to Sophie, Louise, and Jamie who seated and served us!

7TzDruy4hKCOOJNmA1Oznw.text: Had the haggis and black pudding mash.  It was awesome.  The IPA in draft was great.  Great atmosphere.  Friendly waitresses.

AWc7QF8XcluKGmziIi20iA.text: I had a lovely dinner with a friend here. The ambiance and decor was great, and the server we had was really nice and friendly. We came on a voucher deal and enjoyed prosecco and the lamb and mash. Part of my lamb was cold which wasn't great but otherwise the dish had good flavour and was a very big portion. Once we had finished, both our normal server and another server kept coming over to ask if we wanted anything else. Although  they were probably trying to be friendly and helpful, it felt like they wanted us to buy more or head out although there were empty tables around so we weren't in the way. Overall, it was a nice dinner but I wouldn't rush back if not on a voucher.

photos.caption: Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom

XZNPE-2w2Z7tFa39wIU0OA.text: If you have never tried Haggis and want to dip your toes in those waters, come here. Great service, amazing food. The rosti blew my mind and it turns out that haggis is delicious. An added bonus of this place is the beer and spirits selections, as well as the fact that it's an independently owned Edinburgh establishment, which makes it a dying breed.

3O57jKKLw27GNeECPfm2Hg.text: Where do I begin? Super friendly staff, great menu and the food was fabulous. We recommend the lamb shank and Bonnie Prince Charlie chicken. My husband went for the Hagis  and turnips and raved about it.  We were surprised with the ample servings based on the prices...very ample. Save room for dessert because the sticky toffee pudding is marvelous.

photos.caption: Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Amazing food and reasonably priced.  It&#39;s a winner! Make sure to save room for the sticky toffee pudding.

2IfiAOvXWsAACmg-Zt3O4w.text: Pick a main and pick a mash - fun and delicious. The main arrives atop the mash. Clean and fresh decor. Scottish cider paired perfectly with our meal. Priced right and healthy portion sizes.

MCBWkf3bAIf22wLOsmCS7A.text: Just had coffee here, but insanely cute on the inside. Decor was lovely and seating was plenty. Nice staff and gluten free options I think. Would stop back in here for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Latte

69zldiZD-gMrSt8_RQnQ5Q.text: Walked in and was promptly greeted with a 9% triple IPA by the lovely bartender who gave us a brief history of the local brew while we waited for the table. The ambiance was great and the food was delicious. I've never had real haggis, but the veggie haggis was fantastic! 10 out of 10 would eat there again.   PS: My buddy said I had to mention how good the braised lamb was.

wufW1XLJnSPvA8OB4TjQ2w.text: I ordered the vegetarian Hagis off of their main entree and it was delicious! They were also very accommodating to my friend's severe allergy to mustard since their menu primarily consisted mustard flour. The staff never rushed us as we were the last to leave the restaurant drinking beers and having a great time. Very impressed overall!

rz_1Q4xYgKD0oY3UDiiITg.text: The haggis here is sublime.  Forget all the bad press you have heard about haggis and eat haggis here.  This is one of my favorite places to eat in Edinburgh.  Great service, excellent food, great quotes on the wall.

photos.caption: Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Makars Gourmet Mash Bar - Old Town, Edinburgh, United Kingdom

k2PGzx9fg2w3JNvkP9ca4w.text: Stopped in while on a tour - so not a full review, but we certainly got a feel for the place.  Had some black pudding and a drink - both were good.  Servers were nice.
